lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: I am living my dream of studying birds in a beautiful environment (and getting paid to do it).  By providing Kiva loans, I hope I can help others pursue their dreams and to find the kind of fulfillment I currently enjoy.
lenders.occupational_info: I develop and conduct research and monitoring projects on Sonoran desert birds.  I manage several projects that cover a large area, for which collaboration with my ever-expanding network of friends and collaborators is often necessary and is always appreciated.  Also, I participate in several partnerships and working groups whose goal is to improve our understanding of and address issues related to the distribution and population trends of birds in the U.S. and Mexico.

lenders.loan_because: it is a great way to help people on the small budget that I have right now.

it supports sustainable development and

lenders.name: Jim & Katie
lenders.loan_because: We both understand the need for funds when starting a new business from personal experience.  The self-sufficiency of owning your own business is empowering and a positive asset for yourself and your local economy.
lenders.occupational_info: We are now retired, but have both owned retail stores.  Jim had manufacturing businesses, taught university business classes and most recently was President of JanSport, Eastpak, Kipling International.

lenders.name: Rene
lenders.loan_because: i care

lenders.occupational_info: own a small business and am a communications advisor.

lenders.name: Denis
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people like my mother who worked hard at home to give us more than she ever had...

lenders.name: Ole Bendik

lenders.name: melissa & her 3 kids
lenders.loan_because: My family is in business and we needed loans from traditional sources to start out, so passing it onward to others who are trying to help themselves is exciting.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with companies looking to hire professionals and I find professionals looking for new jobs.  Then I introduce them to each other.

lenders.name: Karen
lenders.loan_because:
microfinancing is something I believe in.
People who want to improve their lives want to do so with dignity and integrity, and KIVA is a way to achieve that goal.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in foreign policy, and believe that microfinancing is a better tool of diplomacy than a multi-million dollar loan because it's a people to people connection.

lenders.name: Seeding a dream
lenders.loan_because: We want our combined families to have the opportunity of sharing in this project. They have been 'givers' all their lives and seeded many dreams within our families.

lenders.loan_because: Everyone needs help and everyone needs someone to believe in them.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English in an elementary school in South Korea.

lenders.name: Michele
lenders.loan_because: a small wave can join with a  larger wave that washes the world with hope.

lenders.loan_because: It is important to try to do something positive,  wherever  you are.

lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: Fun, exciting, creative, innovative.

lenders.name: Kelly
lenders.loan_because: Life is not a rehearsal.
lenders.occupational_info: I help students find and get scholarships for university.

lenders.name: Christine
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others achieve their dreams and goals in life.

lenders.name: KrazyLadies
lenders.loan_because: We are blessed to be able to do so.
lenders.occupational_info: Our work includes supporting our families -- children, husbands, grandchildren, greatgrandchildren, and more.  Our work is to nurture, support and empower each other, ourselves, and those whose paths cross with ours.

lenders.name: Miriam
lenders.loan_because: I know what's its like having a dream and not knowing how to accomplish it without the monetary resources.   Through Kiva we can lend a helping hand to people who are not willing to just settle for nothing.  People have dreams and if we can help make their dreams come true then its all worthwhile. Kiva is a wonderful way to help people make loans and not have to be limited by credit bureau bureaucracy.  Thumbs up!
lenders.occupational_info: My current position is only temporary.  I am working as a Postal Clerk Assistant to the Army APO in Vilseck, Germany.  I enjoy working there and being useful to the military community.  I love working with Soldiers and their family members.  Being in Germany is a great experience and we get to travel to bordering countries.

lenders.name: Kristiaan
lenders.loan_because: the money I supply for loans can hopefully make a big difference in their lifes. (and a small one in mine ;-)

lenders.name: Alastair
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a meaningful and life changing contribution to the world we live in. In conjunction with my involvement with a New York based charity called Orphans International, this will enable me to continue helping people in the developing world improve their standard of living.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in Mergers & Acquisitions for an International Boutique Investment Bank, facilitating cross border transactions between North America and Europe.

lenders.name: Alicia
lenders.loan_because: I can't believe how much good I can do with a small amount of money.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach writing at a community college.

lenders.name: Nancy
lenders.loan_because: In my travels I have been amazed at the resilience of the human spirit in the face of adversity. I believe that, with these loans, I can make a difference in promoting peace,  justice, and understanding around the globe.
lenders.occupational_info: Active volunteer, Reiki Master, gardener, sailor, world traveler.

lenders.name: Linda
lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves a chance to better themselves

lenders.name: Marian
lenders.loan_because: I am a single mother and am building my own business to support my family.  I want to help others in whatever way I can to do the same.
lenders.occupational_info: I use broken, thrown away clear and colored glass to make colorful windows and lamps.

lenders.name: Jacob
lenders.loan_because: Kiva makes perfect economic sense: providing capital so that people can work on their own.

lenders.name: Viki
lenders.loan_because: I was once a single mother and know the struggles you face raising a child alone - there were people who helped me out when I most needed it and I want to repay - this is an excellent way to help someone who was in a similar situation
lenders.occupational_info: I sell home decor and gift products direct to retailers

lenders.name: Donald

lenders.occupational_info: Our parents migrated to Burma from China.  We migrated to US.  We worked hard and very fortunate to live a great life.  In honor to our beloved late parents, we would like to share our luck with people who are willing to work hard to improve their life.

lenders.name: Killerflies

lenders.occupational_info: Currently researching lung disease and fly-fishing when time allows.

lenders.loan_because: As a global citizen, I believe in helping those who want to help themselves.  Kiva is a hand-up rather than a hand-out.  How awesome is that?

lenders.name: jodie and don
lenders.loan_because: we are all connected through God

lenders.name: Josh

lenders.occupational_info: I provide commercial legal services to domestic entities and individuals.

lenders.occupational_info: For my job: I help people with disabilities get to work, feel productive and give back to their families, their communities and to themselves.  I have always done volunteer work and enjoy giving of myself.

lenders.occupation: IT Industry Procurement Professional and Mom
lenders.loan_because: I believe we can make this world a better place, and leave it to our children better than we found it. My country (Bosnia) was destroyed by a brutal war in the '90s. 7 members of my family were killed. We lost everything we had: people we loved and our home. People we didn't know helped us pull our life together. Now I'm just doing a little bit that I can to help someone else. I sincerely hope it gives them hope to carry on.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a large computer company. I buy computer software products, which we then sell with our computers. It is great to work with people from many countries, races and religions. I'm also a mom to two little boys, who are the light of my life.

lenders.loan_because: I believe in Karma.

lenders.name: Betsy

I love supporting entrepreneurs!
-especially in distant places. We are all connected.

lenders.occupational_info: I live in a small town and do several things.  I have a degree in civil engineering that has opened up many doors for me.  I am a retired land surveyor.  A land surveyor measures the land for documentation.  After retiring, I am now helping my son with his business.

lenders.occupational_info: I take care of my daughters, it is a great job, I am very lucky.

lenders.name: Lindsay
lenders.loan_because: in order to help yourself, you must help others.

lenders.name: Teresa

lenders.name: Rosa

lenders.name: Monica
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference in the lives of others.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with people to help them have happier families and friends.

lenders.name: Dan and clan
lenders.loan_because: I believe that individuals make the difference. We  control our  destiny to impact our global society, we need but choose to act.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with interesting technologies that improve productivity and enhance the ability to conduct business electronically.

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: I was in the Peace Corps in Colombia 40 years ago and wish there had been a program like this back then.

lenders.name: Lesley
lenders.loan_because: I feel lucky  to have recieved so much.  I want to give something back.

lenders.name: Seiders Family
lenders.loan_because: Our family has been very blessed, and we want to share those blessings.  We also believe in hard work and taking charge of one's life.  God bless these people who have the desire to make a difference in THEIR life!

lenders.loan_because: Our faith teaches us of a God that loves each and calls us to help others
lenders.occupational_info: Brian is a software programmer and a volunteer minister.  Kathy is a medical coder for a Chicago hospital.  Ashlyn and Isaac are both students in school

lenders.name: Gonçalo Luz
lenders.loan_because: I believe in great changes through simple actions. I believe simple actions have the power to improve lives, for the better.

lenders.name: Maria
lenders.loan_because: I have lived in both Central & South America and I know how hard single mothers work to feed and educate their families.  I just want to assist someone make a better life.

lenders.name: Nan
lenders.loan_because: I believe in person-to-person philosophy of Kiva and it's emphasis on progress over poverty.  I am blessed and I want to share that hope with others.

lenders.name: Octavio
lenders.loan_because: We are just ONE.
lenders.occupational_info: Living a life and making sense for me and others.

lenders.name: Kristina
lenders.loan_because: I have a burden for people who want to make something of their lives but are restricted financially.
lenders.occupational_info: I take care of the children who don't have family to be there for them.

lenders.name: Gregory
lenders.occupational_info: I teach people how to sing.

lenders.name: mommy,daddy,nicky,&nati
lenders.loan_because: We believe in helping people take control of their own lives,  even better than fishing for someone, enabling them to make a living by fishing.
lenders.occupational_info: Dad, is the General Manager for Procter & Gamble's operations in Puerto Rico.  So he too is a business person responsible for efficiently running a business operation.

lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.loan_because: It's fun, and a better investment than Wall Street right now.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a student at Whitman College in Walla Walla, Washington, studying politics and environmental studies.

lenders.name: Erick
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.

lenders.name: Heather
lenders.loan_because: I want my kids to grow up knowing how truly lucky they are, and that it is within their power to help someone.

lenders.name: Doug
lenders.occupation: Web developer for a major U.S. airline
lenders.loan_because: The world's resources are unfairly distributed (cruelly so) and this is a small step in the right direction.
lenders.occupational_info: The team I work with is a wonderful mixture of skilled people (marketers, testers, computer programmers); we work together to add features on the airline's website and make life easier for our customers.  Outside of work I enjoy travel, hiking, and spending time with my partner.

lenders.name: Cathy
lenders.loan_because: I have it and they don't
lenders.occupational_info: I keep track of money for a union, make sure things are paid properly, and provide information so the union can plan for future expenses.

lenders.name: Debbie and Daniel
lenders.loan_because: we are lucky enough to be able to.

lenders.name: The Woolley's
lenders.loan_because: We need to give back & realize how fortunate we are.
lenders.occupational_info: I cook for private parties & provide staffing & he trains drivers.

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.loan_because: as Gandhi said, "Be the change you wish to see in the world."

lenders.name: Sandra
lenders.loan_because: I am living a beautiful life, and want to help others live a beautiful life.
lenders.occupational_info: I write novels about changing the world through the power of positive thought.

lenders.name: Chase Rief
lenders.loan_because: I like to help people help themselves.  This is a great program - much better than a straight hand out.
lenders.occupational_info: This is a great program and I love seeing it evolve and grow over time.

lenders.name: Aiysha
lenders.loan_because: As a student of economics I have learned that there has been so much development to help those who already have and no development to help those who don't. I feel that it is imperative and inevitable that we all come together to do our part to create a new pillar in the foundation of this worlds economy. It is amazing how such a small contribution can make a world of difference, and it is about time micro finance became an integral part of the way we do business.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student of economics bored and annoyed of the same monotonist capitalistic theories taught in school. I am looking for new frontiers to become a part of, and want to be a part of better cause than helping the rich get richer, I want to help those who have hopes and dreams make them come true for a better life for themselves and their families.

lenders.name: Brian
lenders.loan_because: I can afford to.
lenders.occupational_info: university teaching

lenders.name: Celebrating Friends
lenders.loan_because: Anytime is a good time to celebrate friendship and share our good fortune.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: It's the responsibility of everyone alive to look after those less fortunate than they.  We get through the hardships of this world easiest by paying forward the courtesies we've enjoyed.

lenders.name: Barb
lenders.loan_because:
I began making loans through Kiva over 4 years ago, in memory of my father, who taught me to believe that we can all change the world. It doesn't have to be on some grand scale - sometimes the smallest gifts will produce the largest benefits.

Now I am totally hooked - each time repayments are made, I can fund yet another venture, and so on and so on. My thanks to Kiva and all of those who contribute for making this possible.

lenders.name: Deb and WWW
lenders.loan_because: We all have what we need- we want to help others, particularly women.
lenders.occupational_info: We are a varied group of women, some working, some retired, but all very involved in our community

lenders.name: Jeffrey

lenders.occupational_info: Heartfelt.

lenders.name: Joe and Mary Kay
lenders.loan_because: We want to make a difference.

lenders.name: Virginia
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed in my life, and I hope I can make a small difference in a constructive way for my sisters and brothers across the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I write manuals that explain how to use something, such as a computer or a music player (iPod).

lenders.name: LB2
lenders.loan_because: I care that there are others in the world who need an extra hand to just get them started. Im about trying to make a difference in the world & showing my Children that it only takes one person to make a small but  huge change in someone elses life.
lenders.occupational_info: Im a P.T Health Worker and a F/T mom with 3 lovely foster children and 1 son of my own. We are a very busy family who care about the world and the ppl in it. I love my jobs and do them with great compassion.

lenders.name: Heather
lenders.loan_because: We all share one world: a small blue marble in a huge black sky. Citizens of the First World should foster the development of an educated, prosperous and successful middle class around the globe. This, I believe, is an excellent way to create a safer and healthier life for all. Thanks to Kiva for creating a channel for sharing our wealth in a way that honours dedicated effort, healthy ambition and human dignity.
lenders.occupational_info: My staff and I provide financial services to arts and not-for-profit organizations. We offer bookkeeping and data management services, plus support with planning, analysis  and reporting.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a large casino.

lenders.name: Kelly, Scott & Shane
lenders.loan_because: We want to help people who are willing to help themselves for a better life.
lenders.occupational_info: Skin Care Specialist

lenders.name: Mihwa
lenders.loan_because: I want all the people in the world to be happy.
lenders.occupational_info: I am 35 years old woman from Seoul, South Korea. I am working for a cosmetic company. Last night I watched Oprah Winfrey show and I've got to know about Kiva.org. I was so touched and just carried the inspiration into practice today. I am very happy that I became a lender. Thank you, Kiva!

lenders.name: Patrick and Juliet
lenders.loan_because: I would like to make a difference and demonstrate to my grandaughter what can be done to help others who are in need.
lenders.occupational_info: I operate a power plant that produces electricity.

lenders.name: Virginia
lenders.loan_because: Whether you know how to fish or not is inconsequential if you don't have a a fishing pole.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: I love the concept of a hand up vs. a hand out.

lenders.name: Katie
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate and I hope to help others.

lenders.name: Ann
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Mari
lenders.loan_because: I want to help other people build better lives for themselves
lenders.occupational_info: I am a health practitioner who tries to empower my clients to heal themselves as much as possible while I am treating them, so they do not depend on me forever.  I believe in supporting the Kiva entrepreneurs because  I want to "help people help themselves"- that is the best way to make the world a better place.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.occupational_info:
Charitable, and kindly...
though i am unemployed, others are in worse shape than I.

lenders.name: Sonya
lenders.loan_because: Sometimes we all just need a little help.  Helping in a small way can make such a big difference in someone's life.
lenders.occupational_info: Girl Scouts is an organization that helps girls develop confidence, courage and character.  They work on activities that help them develop a strong value system and positive leadership skills.

lenders.name: Benjamin
lenders.loan_because: a lucky accident of latitude and longitude allows me to do so.
lenders.occupational_info: I study Neuroscience at Westminster College in Salt Lake City, Utah.  I volunteer with many organizations that seek to end hunger and homelessness, both in Salt Lake City and abroad.

lenders.name: Kayla
lenders.loan_because: It's the least I can do to help my global community.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people find the information they need.

lenders.name: Favo Family
lenders.loan_because: My grandfather was first generation American, the second oldest in a family of 14.  He had an 8th grade education.  Somehow this man was able to get capital and start a number of businesses.  He was successful and help a great deal of people.I do not know how he ever got those first loans,   but we want to pay it forward to those hard working people in the world,  who have the odds against them,  but are willing to take a chance.  We hope our loans can help.

lenders.name: Adrian & Peggy
lenders.loan_because: We can think of few better ways to help people become self sufficient. Using the same money many times to help an increasing number of people help themselves is perfect.

lenders.name: Nancy
lenders.loan_because: I love culture
lenders.occupational_info: tedious

lenders.name: Sheldon
lenders.loan_because: It just feels nice.
lenders.occupational_info: Work with children and adults who are having problems adjusting to life.

lenders.name: Jason
lenders.loan_because:
I can so I do...share the wealth so to speak.....the little I loan is a mere pitance to me, but it is life changing for the the loan reciepients. It makes me feel good to help someone out. I appreciate my good fortune in life and realize how fortuante i am as a canadian citzen.

in the end, you do good: you get good
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the pet food industry as a territory sales manager for a pet food distributor. I call on pet stores to sell the, pet food and pet accessories.

lenders.name: jacob
lenders.loan_because: It is the easiest, smartest, no-brainer way to help people out. And with my limited sources, I can make a difference over and over again.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in Jewish non-profits to help people live lives filled with joy, meaning and loving kindness. I do this because all humans are connected to One Source and to help someone else is to help oneself.

lenders.name: Chunsang

lenders.name: Brenda

lenders.occupational_info: I'm 11yrs old and in 6th grade. I like crafts, singing, dancing, and being with my friends. I also love computers.

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: it takes so little to make such a large difference!

lenders.name: Cale
lenders.loan_because: My finance and I are graduate students at the University of Wisconsin (I am pursing my MBA, and Michelle is pursuing her Masters in Education).  We found this opportunity to invest as an excellent way to support entrepreneurs in developing regions of the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for Cummins Inc (www.cummins.com).   Cummins is a global manufacturer of diesel power solutions.  I am responsible for sourcing activities for the North American After Market business.

lenders.name: Josh
lenders.loan_because: I like to make people happy.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Technology Manager at a large advertising agency in New York City.  My group within the company builds websites and interactive media for customers.

lenders.name: Stewart

lenders.occupational_info: I manage a group of software engineers and write software to manage and track the usage of web applications.

lenders.name: Wednesdays Pick Up
lenders.loan_because: Every Little Bit Helps
lenders.occupational_info: We are hunter gatherers. Professionals in antique restoration, we started as a company with the mission to restore articles of the past. In our journey over the past 8 years, we have teetered on the line of collectors, played with the title of "hoarders" (only for a while, promise) and now we are gathering our knowledge, experience, and most importantly for you, our awesome collection into one store. We are Wednesdays Pick Up.

lenders.name: Rozel
lenders.loan_because: Matthew 5:42

lenders.occupational_info: mother to two small children and helpmate to my husband and our family business.
